posts.post_content:
Wait, this forced attack thing has even appeared on an equipment?  
  
As of now, there have been 39 "attack(s) each turn if able" permanents so far; they have been sporadically popping up for years now. Include "attack(s) this turn if able" effects and you get 20 more.  
That makes almost a dozen more cards than there are with double strike (48).  
  
I think they really need to come up with a keyword for that. (Something around the lines of "*bellicosity*" maybe.)  
  
Then it could be like the keyword cousin of *defender*:  
Generally a drawback, but when turned into a feature that other cards can refer to (like [Perimeter Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perimeter Captain), [Overgrown Battlement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overgrown Battlement) or [Vent Sentinel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vent Sentinel)), also comes with remarkable upsides.  
This would also make a nice sub-theme for red or artifact (maybe even green) creatures in a future set.
posts.html:
Wait, this forced attack thing has even appeared on an equipment?

As of now, there have been 39 "attack(s) each turn if able" permanents so far; they have been sporadically popping up for years now. Include "attack(s) this turn if able" effects and you get 20 more.
That makes almost a dozen more cards than there are with double strike (48).

I think they really need to come up with a keyword for that. (Something around the lines of "bellicosity" maybe.)

Then it could be like the keyword cousin of defender:
Generally a drawback, but when turned into a feature that other cards can refer to (like Perimeter Captain, Overgrown Battlement or Vent Sentinel), also comes with remarkable upsides.
This would also make a nice sub-theme for red or artifact (maybe even green) creatures in a future set.

posts.post_content: Why is this rated so low? Put it on [Wandering Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wandering Wolf) and it should be unblockable most of the time in limited. You can even give it hexproof with [Elguad Shieldmate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elguad Shieldmate). Heck, just putting it on a creature with any kind of evasion can be extremely useful. A lot of the time I'm just going to swing in with [Scrapskin Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scrapskin Drake) anyway...

Posted By: joeah100 (4/29/2012 6:20:07 PM)

posts.post_content:
Pray tell, DarthParallax, how will you get this to equip your opponent's Kaalia?
  
   
Anyway, this really sucks compared to something like [Vulshok Battlegear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vulshok Battlegear), which is just {1} more to cast, same to equip, and gives +3/+3 with no downside.
  
   
Still, drew it twice in the pre-release, and played it both times. It does well on [Angelic Wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Wall), where it has no upside and allows your wall to actually kill quite a lot of fliers. Works really well on [Howlgeist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howlgeist), usually gives you a seven-power unblockable!
posts.html:
Pray tell, DarthParallax, how will you get this to equip your opponent's Kaalia?

Anyway, this really sucks compared to something like Vulshok Battlegear, which is just {1} more to cast, same to equip, and gives +3/+3 with no downside.

Still, drew it twice in the pre-release, and played it both times. It does well on Angelic Wall, where it has no upside and allows your wall to actually kill quite a lot of fliers. Works really well on Howlgeist, usually gives you a seven-power unblockable!
